definitions: in a way that is trusted as being accurate or true; with authority

examples.text: he could speak authoritatively on art, philosophy, literature, history, current affairs

shortDefinitions: in way trusted as accurate or true

definitions: in a commanding and self-confident manner that induces respect and obedience

examples.text: she shouted authoritatively, 'Hey you! Drop your weapon, now!'

definitions: in an official capacity or with official sanction, and therefore requiring compliance or obedience

examples.text: the correct interpretation of the Convention can be authoritatively expounded only by the Strasbourg court

shortDefinitions: in official capacity or with official sanction
